title: Casualty spoilers: Mason and Ethan make terrible mistakes tonight
text:
Who’s the real Mason? (Picture: BBC)

This episode of Casualty concentrates quite heavily on relative newcomer Mason (Victor Oshin). Over the space of five days we follow him through some high and low points and also get a glimpse of his home life. Is this the episode where we’ll find out why he acts like he does, and will Mason finally come good?

Meanwhile, David (Jason Durr)’s ex-wife wants Ollie (Harry Collett) to come back to live with her. David’s not happy about it, but will he manage to stand up for what he wants this time, or has he lost Ollie again? And Ethan (George Rainsford) and Effie (Abigail Hardingham) grow closer as she tries to decide whether to go on the CF trial. Here are all the spoilers to look out for.

1. At the beginning of the episode we see Mason being interviewed by Ethan. He reassures Ethan that ‘things are going great’ – but are they really? And why does he have a bruise on his face? Flashbacks to the week leading up to that point might give us some answers.

2. Ethan is reluctant to give Effie advice about whether to go on the CF trial or not. What will she decide?

3. David is upset to hear that his ex-wife wants Ollie to live with her again. Both Ollie and David pretend they don’t really mind, but Rosa (Jacey Salles) is determined to make David face up to how he really feels about Ollie. Will she manage to get through to both father and son?

Is Ethan heading for heartbreak? (Picture: BBC)

4. The ED staff team are doing their best to be supportive, friendly and welcoming to Mason but his arrogant attitude threatens to turn them all away – especially as he can always find someone to shift the blame to when things go wrong.

5. Effie is rushed into resus when she finds it hard to breathe – and it looks like both Ethan and Effie feel more than just a doctor/patient bond. Is Ethan heading for heartbreak?

6. Patients this week include a woman with breathing difficulties and a roast dinner to prepare, and a woman whose fall from a wall is just the tip of the iceberg of a whole host of problems.

Does David want Rosa’s advice? (Picture: BBC)

7. In a week in which he manages to upset several of his colleagues, Mason shows glimpses of what a good doctor he could be. But when he realises he’s overlooked a vital test on a patient will he be able to correct his mistake in time?
